recipes.name: Lemon Ginger Tea
instructions: Boil water in a saucepan.
Add freshly grated ginger and lemon slices to the boiling water.
Let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Add black tea bags and steep for 3-4 minutes.
Remove from heat, strain, and add honey to taste.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Orange Spice Tea
instructions: In a saucepan, combine water, orange zest, cinnamon sticks, and cloves.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add black tea leaves and steep for 3-4 minutes.
Strain the tea into cups.
Optionally, sweeten with honey or sugar.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chamomile Lavender Tea
instructions: Boil water in a pot.
Place chamomile and lavender flowers in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the flowers.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve. Optionally, sweeten with honey or a slice of lemon.

recipes.name: Orange Blossom Chamomile Tea
instructions: Boil water in a pot.
Place chamomile flowers and orange blossoms in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the flowers.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve. Optionally, add a slice of orange for extra flavor.

recipes.name: Passionflower and Lemon Balm Tea
instructions: Bring water to a boil.
Place dried passionflower and lemon balm leaves in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the herbs.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve. Sweeten with honey if desired.

recipes.name: Chamomile Peppermint Lavender Tea
instructions: Boil water in a pot.
Place chamomile flowers, peppermint leaves, and lavender flowers in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the flowers and leaves.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve. Optionally, add honey for sweetness.

recipes.name: Lemon Chamomile Ginger Tea
ingredients: 1 teaspoon dried ginger slices or grated ginger
instructions: Bring water to a boil.
Place chamomile flowers, ginger, and lemon zest in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the ingredients.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve. Optionally, sweeten with honey.

recipes.name: Linden Red Clover Lemon Balm Tea
instructions: Boil water in a pot.
Place dried linden flowers, red clover blossoms, and lemon balm leaves in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the flowers and leaves.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve.

recipes.name: Marigold-Linden Tea
instructions: Boil water in a pot.
Place dried linden flowers and marigold petals in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the flowers.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve.

recipes.name: Echinacea Rose Immune Booster
instructions: Bring water to a boil.
Place dried echinacea and rose petals in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the herbs.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and add honey or lemon juice to taste.

recipes.name: Lavender Lemon Balm Relaxation Tea
instructions: Boil water in a pot.
Place lemon balm leaves and lavender flowers in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the herbs.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve.

recipes.name: Refreshing Mint and Rose Tea
instructions: Boil water in a pot.
Place peppermint leaves and rose petals in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the herbs.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve.

recipes.name: Floral Symphony Tea
instructions: Bring water to a boil.
Combine rose buds, lavender, and chamomile in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour hot water over the floral blend and steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup and sweeten as desired.

recipes.name: Chamomile Lavender Tea
instructions: Boil water in a pot.
Place chamomile and lavender flowers in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the flowers.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve. Optionally, sweeten with honey or a slice of lemon.
Serve hot or chilled over ice.

recipes.name: Orange Blossom Chamomile Tea
instructions: Boil water in a pot.
Place chamomile flowers and orange blossoms in a teapot or heatproof container.
Pour the boiling water over the flowers.
Steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and serve. Optionally, add a slice of orange for extra flavor.

recipes.name: Raspberry Leaf with Dried Berry Mix
ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed dried berries (cranberries, blueberries, raspberries)
instructions: Boil water.
Add raspberry leaves and dried berries to a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 10 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy this tea for its natural fruity flavor.

recipes.name: Lemon Balm with Citrus Peel
ingredients: 1 tablespoon dried citrus peel (orange or lemon)
instructions: Boil water.
Add lemon balm and citrus peel to a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 8-10 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy the citrus-infused tea.

recipes.name: Ginger with Dried Peach Slices
ingredients: 1 teaspoon fresh or dried ginger, chopped
instructions: Boil water.
Add ginger and dried peach slices to a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 10 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy the fruity warmth of this tea.

recipes.name: Peppermint and Dried Strawberry Slices
instructions: Boil water.
Combine peppermint and dried strawberry slices in a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 10 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy the refreshing fruit-infused tea.

recipes.name: Fennel Seeds and Dried Apple
instructions: Boil water.
Add fennel seeds and dried apple pieces to a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy the mild fruity flavor.

recipes.name: Echinacea and Dried Elderberry
instructions: Boil water.
Combine echinacea and dried elderberries in a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 10 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy the natural sweetness and immune-boosting properties.

recipes.name: Lavender and Dried Blueberry Tea
instructions: Boil water.
Add lavender and dried blueberries to a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy the soothing yet fruity flavor.

recipes.name: Dandelion Leaf and Dried Citrus Peel
ingredients: 1 tablespoon dried citrus peel (lemon or orange)
instructions: Boil water.
Combine dandelion leaves and dried citrus peel in a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 10 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy the refreshing citrus blend.

instructions: Boil water.
Add stinging nettle, dried apple pieces, and spices to a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 10 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy the warming fruity tea.

instructions: Boil water.

Pour the boiling water over them and let steep for about 10 minutes.
Strain into a cup and enjoy the naturally sweet aroma.

recipes.name: Ginger Honey Lemon Soother with Maple Syrup
instructions: Boil water.
Add ginger and lemon balm to a teapot.
Pour boiling water over herbs and steep for 7-10 minutes.
Strain into a cup, add maple syrup to taste, and enjoy this comforting, sweet, and citrusy tea.

Pour boiling water over herbs and steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup, add caramel syrup to taste, and indulge in this floral and citrusy delight.

Pour boiling water over rose buds and steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup, add honey to taste, and enjoy the delicate, sweet aroma of roses.

Pour boiling water over herbs and steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup, add maple syrup to taste, and enjoy the subtle sweetness of raspberry.

recipes.name: Lavender Dream with Almond Syrup

Pour boiling water over herbs and steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup, add almond syrup to taste, and relish the soothing, floral sweetness.

Strain into a cup, add maple syrup to taste, and enjoy the delicate sweetness of linden.

Pour boiling water over herbs and steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup, add caramel syrup to taste, and savor the natural sweetness of fennel and licorice.

recipes.name: Thyme Lemon Balm Honey Sweetness

Pour boiling water over thyme and lemon balm leaves and steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup, add honey to taste, and enjoy the subtle sweetness of thyme.

recipes.name: Chamomile Caramel Bliss

instructions: Boil water.
Add chamomile (and lavender, if using) to a teapot.
Pour boiling water over herbs and steep for 5-7 minutes.
Strain into a cup, add caramel syrup to taste, and enjoy this naturally sweet and calming tea.
